[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/mod.rs] [Constants: Line 38-69] [Missing CF creation] If a new schema is added but its column family constant isn't added to the appropriate db_options.rs function, can this cause runtime panics when trying to access non-existent column families? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/mod.rs] [Constants: DEFAULT_COLUMN_FAMILY_NAME usage] [Empty CF misuse] Is the default/empty column family properly isolated from schema data, or can bugs cause critical data to be accidentally written to the default CF where it's unvalidated? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/mod.rs] [Schema modules + BCS] [Deserialization bomb] Do schemas that use bcs::from_bytes for deserialization (imported via schema modules) properly validate input size before decoding, preventing memory exhaustion attacks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/mod.rs] [Schema modules] [Type confusion] Can malicious BCS-encoded data cause type confusion when deserializing schema values, potentially violating Move's type safety and causing state corruption? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/mod.rs] [Schema modules] [Version skew] If different validator nodes use different schema versions with incompatible BCS encodings, can this cause consensus failures when validators can't decode each other's state? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/mod.rs] [Validation functions + BCS] [Malformed BCS] Can BCS-encoded data pass ensure_slice_len_eq/ensure_slice_len_gt checks but still be malformed (e.g., incorrect internal length prefixes), causing crashes during decoding? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/mod.rs] [Constants: WRITE_SET_CF_NAME] [Write set validation] Are write sets stored in WRITE_SET_CF_NAME properly validated against corresponding transactions in TRANSACTION_CF_NAME to prevent unauthorized state modifications? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/mod.rs] [Constants: VERSION_DATA_CF_NAME] [Version monotonicity] Does VERSION_DATA_CF_NAME enforce version monotonicity, or can malicious validators insert transactions with non-sequential versions to corrupt the ledger history? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/mod.rs] [Constants: STALE_NODE_INDEX_CF_NAME] [Premature pruning] Can bugs in stale node tracking (STALE_NODE_INDEX_CF_NAME) cause active Merkle nodes to be marked stale and pruned, making historical state proofs impossible to generate? (Critical)
